snippet: A federal appellate court was wrong to insist that Rhode Island surrender a prisoner so it can prosecute him in federal court. The state should ask the Supreme Court to review the case.
abstract: Editorial maintains United States Court of Appeals was wrong to insist that Rhode Island surrender custody of accused killer Jason Wayne Pleau so it can prosecute him in federal court, with the option of seeking the death penalty; says government is turning case into a pointless state-federal clash, since it is unlikely that Pleau will be executed; urges Rhode Island to ask the Supreme Court to review the case.
lead_paragraph: A federal appellate court was wrong to insist that Rhode Island surrender a prisoner so it can prosecute him in federal court. The state should ask the Supreme Court to review the case.
